member.name: T:Photon.Compression.CompressedFloat
member.summary: A compressed representation of a float. Can be decompressed with this.Decompres() to restore the original float (Lossy).

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.CompressedFloat.crusher
member.summary: The FloatCrusher used to compress a float to this value, and the crusher that will be used to Decompress() it.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.CompressedFloat.cvalue
member.summary: The compressed value. This can be bitpacked and serialized. The actual bits used are found with crusher.Bits - and only that many bits need to be serialized.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.CompressedFloat.Decompress
member.summary: Restore a float from this compressed value using the crusher it was created with.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel.NoCulling
member.summary: No culling is applied.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel.DropThird
member.summary: By default Lvl1 culls the top third of the bits.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel.DropHalf
member.summary: By default Lvl2 culls the top half of the bits.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel.DropAll
member.summary: All bits are culled. This indicates no data.

member.name: T:Photon.Compression.TRSType
member.summary: Setting this slightly changes the behaviour of the compressor to account for what it is being used for. For example, Euler makes the compressor optimize for the nature of eulers (they wrap around at 360 degrees, and the x-axis effectively only uses 180 degrees). The inspector interface changes for the differnet types as well, limiting and exposing options applicable to the various types.

member.name: T:Photon.Compression.BitsDeterminedBy
member.summary: Method by which Bit level will be determined.

member.name: T:Photon.Compression.OutOfBoundsHandling
member.summary: Not fully implemented. Selector for how out of bounds values should be handled when fed to the compressor.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.Crusher`1.OnRecalculated
member.summary: Notification callback for when the crusher values have changed.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.Crusher`1.OnCrusherChange(`0)
member.summary: Callback handler for changes to any child crushers.

member.name: T:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher
member.summary: Define a range and resolution for an float field, and expose encoding/decoding options based on those values.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.ISPRO
member.summary: True if this is the Pro version of FloatCrusher. Used internally for inspector rendering handling.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.staticFloatCrushers
member.summary: Experimental storage of unchanging crushers indexed by their hashcode - for future use to eliminate redundancies

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetStaticFloatCrusher(Photon.Compression.BitPresets,System.Single,System.Single,Photon.Compression.Axis,Photon.Compression.TRSType)
member.summary: Creates a new crusher, then checks to see if its hashcode exists in the static dictionary already. If it exists the existing crusher is returned and the created crusher gets garbage collected. Otherwise the new crusher is added to the hash dictionary.
member.returns: A shared float crusher with the indicated. WARNING: There are no controls in place to stop you from changing the values of this crusher, but they should not be changed. The static FloatCrusher is indexed by its hashcode, and any changes will make that hashcode no longer valid.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetStaticFloatCrusher(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,Photon.Compression.Axis,Photon.Compression.TRSType)
member.summary: Creates a new crusher, then checks to see if its hashcode exists in the static dictionary already. If it exists the existing crusher is returned and the created crusher gets garbage collected. Otherwise the new crusher is added to the hash dictionary.
member.returns: A shared float crusher with the indicated. WARNING: There are no controls in place to stop you from changing the values of this crusher, but they should not be changed. The static FloatCrusher is indexed by its hashcode, and any changes will make that hashcode no longer valid.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.CheckAgainstStatics(Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher)
member.summary: See if a floatcrusher with the same hash (effectively the same crusher) exists in the static dictionary. If so, return the static crusher. If not, add the supplied crusher to the dictionary. NOTE: clear any references to the supplied crusher in order for it to be garbage collected.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.defaultUncompressedCrusher
member.summary: Simple FloatCrusher with settings as a generic uncompressed compressor. Basically just byte converts to uint32 for serialization and all other compression related tasks are bypassed.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.defaulHalfFloatCrusher
member.summary: Simple FloatCrusher with settings as a generic Half compressor. Converts floats to uint16 for serialization and all other compression related tasks are bypassed.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.#cctor
member.summary: Static Constructor

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.axis
member.summary: The X/Y/Z axis associated with this float crusher.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.showBCL
member.summary: Experimental: Shows the BitCullingLevel bit ranges in the inspector.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.expandBCL
member.summary: Experimental: Expands the BitCullingLevel bit ranges in the inspector if showBCL is true.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.showEnableToggle
member.summary: A toggle for enabled appears in the inspector drawer when true.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.enabled
member.summary: Used by ElementCrusher and TransformCrusher to indicate that an axis is not to be included in any operations.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Enabled
member.summary: Used by ElementCrusher and TransformCrusher to indicate that an axis is not to be included in any operations.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.AccurateCenter
member.summary: When true, the highest compressed value is not used, and the next lowest compressed value becomes the max. This produces an odd number of quatized compression steps, which in turn allows for a value to represent an uncompressed value exactly between min and max.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.outOfBoundsHandling
member.summary: Selects how out of range values will be corrected.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.CenterValue
member.summary: Returns the center value with the current range settings, accounting for the AccurateCenter toggle.

member.name: F:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher._bits
member.summary: Make changes to this value through the Bits property and with SetBits() or risk breakage. Backing value is only exposed for fast extension calls.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Min
member.summary: Set value and recalculate the FloatCrusher cache

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Max
member.summary: Set value and recalculate the FloatCrusher cache

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.SetRange(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Change the min and max values, retaining the previous BitsDeterminedBy setting.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.SetRange(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Change the min and max values, and provide a new minimum resolution target. Bits will automatically be determined, using the lowest value that can still provide this level of resolution.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.SetRange(System.Single,System.Single,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Change the min and max values, and provide a new minimum resolution target. Bits will automatically be determined, using the lowest value that can still provide this level of resolution.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.SetRange(System.Single,System.Single,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Change the min and max values, and provide a new minimum resolution target. Bits will automatically be determined, using the lowest value that can still provide this level of resolution.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.SetRange(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Change the min and max values, and provide a new minimum precision target. Bits will automatically be determined, using the lowest value that can still provide this level of precision.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.SetRange(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the bits, min and max values of the crusher.
member.param: Number of bits to compress to. Lower = lossier.
Smallest float value expected to be given.
Largest float value expect to be given.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.MakeRotationMinMaxConform(System.Single)
member.summary: Apply any adjustments to manually entered rotation Min/Max values to make them conform to what is expected by all methods.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.RotationMinLimit
member.summary: Get the Min value for this FloatCrusher, accounting for useHalfRangeX (rotation specific switch). This is only used by inspector code for sizing sliders.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.RotationMaxLimit
member.summary: Get the Max value for this FloatCrusher, accounting for useHalfRangeX (rotation specific switch) This is only used by inspector code for sizing sliders.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.SetToFullRange
member.summary: Set Rotation Range Limits to their max values. (Not used by Position, Scale or Generic types - as they have no limits to their range).

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.TRSType
member.summary: Get/Set the TRS Type (Position, Rotation, Euler, Scale, Generic) for this crusher, and automate any handling code required to apply the change.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.BitsDeterminedBy
member.summary: When using the editor, this setting determines if bitcount is determined by Resolution, Precision, or a manually set bitcount.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Resolution
member.summary: Set value and recalculate

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Precision
member.summary: Set value and recalculate

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Bits
member.summary: Set bits value and recalculate. Get bits setting (no culling level). Returns 0 if disabled.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetBitsAtCullLevel(Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel)
member.summary: Return the bits used at the given BitCullingLevel for this axis' current compression settings.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetBits(Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel)
member.summary: Get the current bits for serialization at the specificed bcl. 0 for standard.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.SetBits(System.Int32,Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel)
member.summary: Set the bits level for this FloatCrusher.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.AutoDetermineBitsForCullLevels(System.Int32)
member.summary: Be sure to Recalculate() after changing bit levels.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.LimitRange
member.summary: Enable or disable ranges (only applicable to rotation - position and scale don't wrap around like rotations so they always need ranges). Disabling range defaults to full rotation on all axes.

member.name: P:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.UseHalfRangeX
member.summary: When true, X axis is restricted to range of 0-180 rather than 0-360. Values outside of this range will be translated by reversing the Y and Z angles accordingly to result in the same eulerAnger result. This reduces rotation network traffic by one bit (in exchange for a small increase in CPU usage).

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Recalculate
member.summary: Any changes to the Min, Max or Bits[0] will require derived values to be recalculated.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.RecalculateMasks
member.summary: Recalculates the masks used for turning upperbits to zeros.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.AutoSelectRotHalfX
member.summary: DefaultX to 180 degrees for x unless the min/max given to the constructor are out of that range.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.#ctor(Photon.Compression.BitsDeterminedBy)
member.summary: Constructor to use when wanting to create Uncompressed or HalfFloat crushers.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,Photon.Compression.Axis,Photon.Compression.TRSType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.#ctor(Photon.Compression.BitPresets,System.Single,System.Single,Photon.Compression.Axis,Photon.Compression.TRSType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,Photon.Compression.Axis,Photon.Compression.TRSType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Photon.Compression.Axis,Photon.Compression.TRSType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.#ctor(Photon.Compression.Axis,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.#ctor(Photon.Compression.Axis,Photon.Compression.TRSType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Compress(System.Single,Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel)
member.summary: The primary Compress (crush) method for this FloatCrusher. Returns a CompressedValue.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Decompress(System.UInt32)
member.summary: The primary Decompress (uncrush) method for this FloatCrusher. Restores a float (lossy) from the compressed value.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetBitsForResolution
member.summary: Determine the fewest bits required to communicate the largest value expected.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetBitsForPrecision
member.summary: Determine the fewest bits required to communicate the largest value expected.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetResAtBits
member.summary: Returns the actual resolution of the current settings (will likely be higher than what was requested)

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetResAtBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the resolution value if supplied bits value was used with current min/max range.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetPrecAtBits
member.summary: Returns the actual precision of the current settings (will likely be higher than what was requested)

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetPrecAtBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the precisions value if supplied bits value was used with current min/max range.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetBitsForValues(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the number of bits needed for serialization based on the min/max/rez values.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetBitsForMaxValue(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns the min number of bits required to describe any value between 0 and uint maxvalue

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GetMaxValueForBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the maximum value that can be described at a certain bitcount.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.ZeroLowerBits(System.UInt32,Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel)
member.summary: Turn all lower order bits to zeros, based on the BitCullingLevel.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.ZeroUpperBits(System.UInt32,Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel)
member.summary: Turn all higher order bits to zeros, based on the BitCullingLevel.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.OverwriteUpperBits(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel)
member.summary: Replace the higher order bits of one CompressedValue with the higher order bits of another.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.GuessUpperBits(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Photon.Compression.BitCullingLevel)
member.summary: Alternative to OverwriteUpperBits that attempts to guess the upperbits by seeing if value of the new position would be closer to the old one if the upper bit is incremented by one, two, three etc. Stops trying when it fails to get a better result than the last increment.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.OutOfBoundsCorrect(System.Single)
member.summary: Apply the out of bounds correction as specified by outOfBoundsHandling.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.ClampRotation(System.Single)
member.summary: Places any out of range rotation values into range. Clamping acounts for wraparound and will pick the correct min/max value to clamp to.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Clamp(System.Single)
member.summary: Clamp value to the ranges of this FloatCrusher.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.Clamp(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns a the compressed value clamped to the limits of this crusher.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.CopyFrom(Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher)
member.summary: Deep copies another crusher's values to this crusher.

member.name: M:Photon.Compression.FloatCrusher.ToString
member.summary: Create a string of the parameters of this FloatCrusher.

member.name: T:FloatCrusherUtilities
member.summary: Extension methods for use with the FloatCrusher class.

member.name: M:FloatCrusherUtilities.GetXCorrectedEuler(UnityEngine.Quaternion)
member.summary: Returns rotation as Euler with X limited to a range of -90 to 90, and the Y reversed as needed. in order to maintain the same orientation.

member.name: M:FloatCrusherUtilities.GetXCorrectedEuler(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns rotation as Euler using the ranges of [x]-90 to 90 [y] -180 to 180 [z] -180 to 180. Y and Z axis will be mirrored when the x is outside of the -90 to 90, in order to maintain orientation.

member.name: M:FloatCrusherUtilities.CheckBitCount(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Conditional test (is completely purged from non-editor builds) that will warn if more bits will be written than are possible.

member.name: M:FloatCrusherUtilities.EditorOnlyError(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: All calls to this replacement for Debug.LogError is completely purged at build time and only exist in the Editor.

member.name: M:FloatCrusherUtilities.EditorOnlyWarning(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: All calls to this replacement for Debug.LogWarning is completely purged at build time and only exist in the Editor.

member.name: M:FloatCrusherUtilities.EditorOnlyLog(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: All calls to this replacement for Debug.Log is completely purged at build time and only exist in the Editor.
